author: @wkyt
title: Local health officials discuss global Mpox outbreak and how it could impact Kentucky
text: Local health officials discuss global Mpox outbreak and how it could impact Kentucky LEXINGTON, Ky. (WKYT) -The last time we saw the World Health Organization declare an Mpox outbreak as a Global Health Emergency was in July of 2022, and it lasted for almost a year. Now, even though we are seeing cases rise outside of the United States, Woodford County Health Department’s Cassie Prather said Kentuckians can do things to prevent cases here. “Thankfully there’s a vaccine, it is a two dose vaccine,” she said. Prather said this vaccine has limited the spread of the disease with only [111 cases in KY since the 2022 outbreak.](https://dashboard.chfs.ky.gov/views/MPOXPublicFacingReport/KentuckyMpoxReportedCases?%3Aembed=y&%3Aiid=1&%3AisGuestRedirectFromVizportal=y) None of those cases have been identified as the Claude 1 variant that is spreading right now. “This variant, the Claude 1 variant, does have potentially more severe symptoms and can cause death,” Prather said. “Monitoring and surveillance are key.” Mpox is most commonly found in men in the LQBTQ+ community. Prather says there are things people at higher risk can look out for; high fever, muscle aches and a rash. If you’re someone considered high risk for Mpox, getting the vaccine will protect you from both variants. “You can come to us without any judgment,” Prather said. “We just want to make sure that we prevent any disease transmission.” On September 13th, the Woodford County Health Department will be at the Black Pride festival at Woodland Park in Lexington to administer Mpox vaccines and free HIV testing. To see if you are eligible for a vaccine and what other Kentucky locations might provide them, you can visit the [Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services’ website.](https://www.chfs.ky.gov/agencies/dph/dehp/idb/Pages/monkeypox.aspx) Copyright 2024 WKYT. All rights reserved.

author: Renascença
title: Trabalhadores das Misericórdias estão em greve este sábado - Renascença
text:
30 nov, 2024 - 05:15 • Lusa
O Sindicato dos Trabalhadores do Comércio, Escritórios e Serviços de Portugal (CESP) convocou para este sábado uma greve dos trabalhadores das Santas Casas de Misericórdia, reivindicando um aumento dos salários, anunciou a estrutura sindical.
O CESP marcou também para este sábado, quando se realiza uma Assembleia Geral da União das Misericórdias Portuguesas (UMP) em Fátima, uma concentração de trabalhadores em greve no mesmo local, disse à agência Lusa Catarina Fachadas, dirigente do sindicato.
Segundo a sindicalista, os trabalhadores reivindicam o aumento pedido para 2024 "de 150 euros a partir do salário mínimo" para todos.
Em relação à greve, Catarina Fachadas referiu que a falta de funcionários obriga a que em muitos estabelecimentos se trabalhe ao nível dos serviços mínimos, o que dificulta a adesão à paralisação.
Além do aumento dos salários de todos, os trabalhadores reivindicam a celebração de um Contrato Coletivo de Trabalho entre o CESP e a UMP, com todos os direitos já conquistados, "tanto no Acordo de Empresa da UMP, como na Portaria de Extensão do CCT das IPSS [Instituições Particulares de Solidariedade Social], nomeadamente o pagamento de diuturnidades".

author: Catrina Cable
title: Uncover The Wonders Of Eisenhower's Legacy | TouristSecrets
text: Uncover The Wonders Of Eisenhower’s Legacy Have you ever wondered what it would be like to step into a piece of history while enjoying modern amenities? Abilene, Kansas, offers just that! Known as the boyhood home of President Dwight D. Eisenhower, this charming city provides a unique blend of historical sites and contemporary attractions. You can visit the Eisenhower Presidential Library, Museum, and Boyhood Home to learn about one of America's most influential leaders. After soaking in the history, stroll through the quaint downtown area filled with local shops and eateries. Whether you're a history buff or just looking for a new adventure, Abilene has something for everyone. Eisenhower National Historic Site The Eisenhower National Historic Site in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania, offers a glimpse into the life of the 34th President of the United States. This serene farm served as Dwight D. Eisenhower's weekend retreat and retirement home. - Eisenhower Home: Explore the beautifully preserved home where Eisenhower entertained world leaders and spent his post-presidency years. - Farm Tour: Take a guided tour of the working farm, complete with cattle, barns, and scenic landscapes. - Visitor Center: Learn about Eisenhower's legacy through exhibits, films, and personal artifacts. Eisenhower Presidential Library, Museum, and Boyhood Home Located in Abilene, [Kansas](/destinations/united-states/kansas/), this site offers a comprehensive look at Eisenhower's life, from his early years to his presidency and beyond. - Presidential Library: Delve into extensive archives, documents, and photographs that chronicle Eisenhower's career. - Museum: Discover exhibits showcasing his military service, presidency, and personal life. - Boyhood Home: Visit the modest house where Eisenhower grew up, gaining insight into his formative years. Eisenhower Memorial The Eisenhower Memorial in [Washington](/destinations/united-states/washington/), D.C., honors the legacy of this influential leader. Designed by architect Frank Gehry, the memorial captures Eisenhower's contributions to the nation. - Sculptures: Admire the bronze sculptures depicting Eisenhower as a young boy, a general, and a president. - Inscribed Quotes: Reflect on Eisenhower's wisdom through his famous quotes etched into the memorial's stone walls. - Tapestry: Marvel at the stainless steel tapestry that portrays the beaches of Normandy, symbolizing Eisenhower's role in World War II. Eisenhower State Park Eisenhower State Park in [Texas](/destinations/united-states/texas/) offers outdoor enthusiasts a chance to enjoy nature while honoring the former president. Situated on the shores of Lake Texoma, this park provides a variety of recreational activities. - Hiking Trails: Explore miles of scenic trails that wind through forests and along the lake. - Fishing and Boating: Enjoy fishing, boating, and water sports on the expansive Lake Texoma. - Camping: Experience the great outdoors with camping options ranging from primitive sites to full hookups. Eisenhower Birthplace State Historic Site In Denison, Texas, the Eisenhower Birthplace State Historic Site preserves the modest home where Dwight D. Eisenhower was born. This site offers a unique look at the early life of the future president. - Birthplace Home: Tour the small, restored house where Eisenhower entered the world. - Visitor Center: Gain insights into Eisenhower's early years through exhibits and displays. - Gardens: Stroll through the beautifully maintained gardens surrounding the historic home. Eisenhower Park Eisenhower Park in East Meadow, [New York](/destinations/united-states/new-york/), is a sprawling recreational area named in honor of the former president. This park offers a wide range of activities for visitors of all ages. - Golf Courses: Tee off at one of the park's three 18-hole golf courses. - Aquatic Center: Dive into the Olympic-sized swimming pool and enjoy other aquatic facilities. - Playgrounds and [Picnic](https://www.touristsecrets.com/travel-guide/weird-amazing/what-is-a-picnic/)Areas: Relax with family and friends at the numerous playgrounds and picnic spots throughout the park. Final Thoughts on Eisenhower's Legacy Eisenhower's Legacy offers a unique blend of history, culture, and natural beauty. From the Eisenhower Presidential Library to the charming downtown area, there's something for everyone. The local cuisine is a treat, with plenty of options to satisfy any palate. Outdoor enthusiasts will love the parks and trails, perfect for hiking and biking. The community events and festivals add a vibrant touch to the city's atmosphere. Whether you're a history buff, a foodie, or an outdoor lover, Eisenhower's Legacy has something to offer. Don't miss out on exploring this hidden gem in the heart of America. Pack your bags, hit the road, and make some unforgettable memories. Eisenhower's Legacy is waiting to be discovered.
